dialogue.User: I would like you to send me an email.

dialogue.System: So, you want me to send an email with a recall alert about frozen strawberries. Is the subject line and body content correct as displayed?
dialogue.User:
Yes, please use "Recall Alert: Frozen Strawberries" as the subject and this HTML for the body: '

Dear Recipient,

The Department of Agriculture has issued a recall for frozen strawberries due to potential Listeria contamination. Please see the attached link for more details and safety instructions.

Sincerely,
Department of Agriculture Recall Notification System

'

dialogue.User: I want to play music on my Android device whenever my Home Connect Cookit starts cooking, specifically using the kitchen appliance ID.
I would like information from Weather Underground.

dialogue.System: So you want tomorrow's weather report from Weather Underground. Could you please provide the time and location for which you need this information?
dialogue.User: I would like the report at 08:00 for Los Angeles, which is located at 34.0522° N, 118.2437° W.

dialogue.System: Now that I have the time and location for tomorrow's weather report, what would you like me to do with this information?
dialogue.User: I would like you to send an email with this information.

dialogue.System: Great! Now that you've specified sending an email as the action, could you please confirm the recipient, carbon copy, blind carbon copy, subject, body and attachment URL for this email?
dialogue.User:
The recipient is john.doe@example.com, with no CC or BCC. The subject will be 'Tomorrow\'s Weather in Los Angeles', the body is '

Hi John,

Just wanted to let you know the weather forecast for tomorrow in Los Angeles:

Expect sunny skies with a high of 75°F and a low of 60°F.

Have a great day!

', and the attachment URL is 'https://www.example.com/weather_report.pdf'.

Hi John,

Just wanted to let you know the weather forecast for tomorrow in Los Angeles:

Have a great day!

', 'https://www.example.com/weather_report.pdf'

dialogue.User: I want every time I save an article on Pocket, you automatically post a tweet with the image from that article.

dialogue.System: So, when I post a tweet with an image from Pocket, what text would you like me to include in the tweet and what is the URL of the photo?
dialogue.User: The tweet should say 'Just saved an interesting article on Pocket! Check it out ➡️ [link to article]' and the photo URL is 'https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1503023345310-bd7c9bc5eb99?ixlib=rb-4.0.3&ixid=M3wxMjA3fDB8MHxzZWFyY2h8Mnx8bGFuZHNjYXBlfGVufDB8fHx8MA%3D%3D'.
